org.vaniglia.performancemonitor
Class PerformanceMonitor

java.lang.Object
  org.vaniglia.performancemonitor.PerformanceMonitor
public class PerformanceMonitor
extends java.lang.Object

The Performance Monitor is a utility class used to keep track of performances of your applications.

Method Detail

getInstance

public static PerformanceMonitor getInstance(java.lang.String name)
This method is used to get a "named" instance of PerformanceMonitor. If the instance doesn't yet exist it is created.

Parameters:
name - the name of the isntance.
Returns:
the instance with the given name or a newly created one.

start

public final void start()
Starts the monitor.

restart

public final void restart()
Resets the monitor.

addLap

public final Lap addLap(java.lang.String lapName,
                        long period,
                        boolean delayed,
                        int historyDepth)
                 throws PerformanceMonitorException
Adds a lap to the Monitor. A lap is a timer that maintain statistics for the given time period. A lap can be configured to keep track of his history using the historyDepth parameter.

Parameters:
lapName - the name of the lap
period - the lap period in milliseconds
delayed - if true, the first period will be (period - currentTimeMillis % period)
historyDepth - the lap history depth. 0 for no history
Returns:
the newly created lap
Throws:
PerformanceMonitorException - if the lap already exists.

addLap

public final Lap addLap(java.lang.String lapName,
                        long period,
                        boolean delayed,
                        int historyDepth,
                        LapAction action)
                 throws PerformanceMonitorException
Adds a lap with an associated action to the Monitor. A lap is a timer that maintain statistics for the given time period. A lap can be configured to keep track his history using the historyDepth parameter.

Parameters:
lapName - the name of the lap
period - the lap period in milliseconds
delayed - if true, the first period will be (period - currentTimeMillis % period)
historyDepth - the lap history depth. 0 for no history
action - the lap action
Returns:
the newly created lap
Throws:
PerformanceMonitorException - if the lap already exists.

addEventAlarm

public final void addEventAlarm(java.lang.String lapName,
                                Alarm alarm)
                         throws PerformanceMonitorException
Adds an event alarm for a given lap of the monitor. An event alarm is an alarm based on the numeber of events received by a lap in his time period. If the alarm threshold is exceeded than the alarm task related to the alarm is called.

Parameters:
lapName - the name of the lap you want to configure with the given alarm
alarm - the alarm
Throws:
PerformanceMonitorException - if the lap doesn't exists.

addRateAlarm

public final void addRateAlarm(java.lang.String lapName,
                               Alarm alarm)
                        throws PerformanceMonitorException
Adds a rate alarm for a given lap of the monitor. A rate alarm is an alarm based on the average event/msec received by a lap in his time period. If the alarm threshold is exceeded than the alarm task related to the alarm is called.

Parameters:
lapName - the name of the lap you want to configure with the given alarm
alarm - the alarm
Throws:
PerformanceMonitorException - if the lap doesn't exists.

addAverageLatencyAlarm

public final void addAverageLatencyAlarm(java.lang.String lapName,
                                         Alarm alarm)
                                  throws PerformanceMonitorException
Adds an average latency alarm for a given lap of the monitor. An average latency alarm is an alarm based on the average latency mesured by the lap in his time period. If the alarm threshold is exceed than the alarm task related to the alarm is called.

Parameters:
lapName - the name of the lap you want to configure with the given alarm
alarm - the alarm
Throws:
PerformanceMonitorException - if the lap doesn't exists.

addMaxLatencyAlarm

public final void addMaxLatencyAlarm(java.lang.String lapName,
                                     Alarm alarm)
                              throws PerformanceMonitorException
Adds a max latency alarm for a given lap of the monitor. A Max latency alarm is an alarm based on the max latency mesured by the lap in his time period. If the alarm threshold is exceed than the alarm task related to the alarm is called.

Parameters:
lapName - the name of the lap you want to configure with the given alarm
alarm - the alarm
Throws:
PerformanceMonitorException - if the lap doesn't exists.

update

public final void update(long events)
Deprecated. this method assumes a latency of 0ms for the calls. The new update method (with events and latencies parameters) should be used.

Updates the monitor with n events.

Parameters:
events - the number of events handled.

update

public final void update(long events,
                         long latencies)
Updates the monitor with n events.

Parameters:
events - the number of events handled.
latencies - the total latencies for the events on update.

applyPendingUpdates

protected final void applyPendingUpdates()
This method applies all pending updates to the monitor and to all the laps.

stop

public final void stop()
Stops the monitor.

printTotals

public final void printTotals(java.io.PrintStream out)
This method prints to a given PrintStream the monitor total statistics.

Parameters:
out - the PrintStream to print to.

printTotals

public final void printTotals(org.apache.log4j.Logger logger,
                              org.apache.log4j.Level level)
This method prints to a given log4j Logger the monitor total statistics.

Parameters:
logger - the Logger to print to.
level - the log level.

printLap

public final void printLap(java.lang.String lapName,
                           java.io.PrintStream out)
                    throws PerformanceMonitorException
This method prints to a given PrintStream a lap of the monitor.

Parameters:
lapName - the name of the lap you want to print
out - the PrintStream to print to
Throws:
PerformanceMonitorException - if the lap doesn't exists.

printLap

public final void printLap(java.lang.String lapName,
                           org.apache.log4j.Logger logger,
                           org.apache.log4j.Level level)
                    throws PerformanceMonitorException
This method prints to a given PrintStream a lap of the monitor.

Parameters:
lapName - the name of the lap you want to print
logger - the Logger to print to.
level - the log level.
Throws:
PerformanceMonitorException - if the lap doesn't exists.

getElapsed

public final long getElapsed()
Returns the elapsed time in milliseconds.

Returns:
elapsed time in milliseconds.

getNumberOfEvents

public final long getNumberOfEvents()
Returns the total number of events.

Returns:
total number of events.

getRate

public final double getRate()
Returns the total rate (events/msecs).

Returns:
the average number of events per millisecond for the whole monitor execution.

_getRate

final double _getRate()
Returns the total rate (events/msecs). This method doesn't apply pending update and so is for internal use only.

Returns:
the average number of events per millisecond for the whole monitor execution.

_getTotalAverageLatency

public double _getTotalAverageLatency()

                 throws PerformanceMonitorException

Parameters:

Returns:
the lap with the given name
Throws:
PerformanceMonitorException - if the lap doesn't exists.

setDateFormat

public static void setDateFormat(java.text.SimpleDateFormat dateFormat)
Sets the monitor date format. This format is used everywhere a date or a time are printed out.

Parameters:
dateFormat - the date format to use for the monitor.

getDateFormat

public static java.text.SimpleDateFormat getDateFormat()
Returns the monitor date format currently set.

Returns:
the monitor date format
